page.title: 11Higher Brownstone Farm
page.content: 15 years ago it was a dairy farm there was 60 cows.The farm is called Higher Brownstone Farm.The farmer George used to collect the cows and take them into the milking parlour and there were six cows and he milked three at a time, then he let them out into a place called the breast stall and then they climbed up into a stall and then they were checked that they hadn't got any diseases then they pulled on a corn bar and the gate opened and the cows jumped out.There were 15 young bulls when George owned the farm.Because his boss had arthritis in his arms all the farm animals were auctioned.Now there is a farmer who rents the farm from Coleton Fishacre.
